intro: Adonis integra, commonly known as the golden foxtail, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in early spring. Its scientific name reflects its historical association with the mythological figure Adonis. Adonis integra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
